text: My name's Jennifer Schaeffer.

I'm the Vice President, Information Technology
and the Chief Information Officer at Athabasca

University, Canada's only 100 percent open
and online digital university.
So right now there's about 40,000 students.

Most of them are working, most of them have
children, and 70 percent of them are the first

person in their family to achieve a university
degree.

We've been hearing really positive feedback
on the first of our migration steps with AWS,
which we did over the summer.

Which was moving our content management of
all our learning, which is the Moodle platform;

hundreds of courses, programs, all of which
are online... moving them to the AWS Cloud.

It feels like the right match for what we're
doing on the cutting edge of digital learning

for Canada, especially with our remote learners
in rural communities, and our international learners.

The reason that it was really important for
us, at Athabasca University, to be at the

forefront of bringing AWS educational programs
into Alberta and into Western Canada, is because,

through those kinds of offerings, we then
can diversify the Western Canadian economy,

because our citizenry will be just that much
more skilled in starting up new businesses,

automating the kind of operational activities
that they may manage or be a staff manager
part of, in all of our industry.

For us to have productivity and innovation
at the national scale, as citizens, we need

to understand how to utilize the best products
and services that are out there for rapid

automation, or rapid innovation, which we
need across our sectors.

So that's the reason that AWS is really important
to the economic diversification of Alberta
and Western Canada as a whole.
